description.value:
Trigger A creature lies down on the bed, or a living creature spends more than 3 rounds inside this room

Effect Incense swiftly fills the room (even if the incense burners have been removed or were destroyed). All creatures in area A12 must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 1} by the incense's scent.

Failure The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Unconscious]. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.

Critical Failure As failure, but if it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.

details.description: The incense burners begin to smoke, filling the air with strangely nostalgic scents.
details.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:26] (expert) to enter a state akin to lucid dreaming so as to unweave the nightmare from within, or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:30] (master) to stand resolute against the nightmares and turn the fear back upon itself
details.reset: The hazard resets when Etward dreams in this room.
details.routine:
(2 actions; cold, enchantment, mental, occult) The haunt uses its first action to light incense burners again, forcing any creature that isn't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Unconscious] to save against that effect once more. Its second action is to cause any unconscious creatures in the room to experience horrific, vivid dreams about being lost in the arctic during a blizzard, while enormous furred figures— saumen kar—lunge at them through the snow to attack repeatedly. Each unconscious creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|traits:cold,enchantment,mental,occult] saving throw. If at the end of the round there are no unconscious creatures in the room, Etward's nightmare ends and the trap deactivates.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and wakes up.

Success The creature remains unconscious and takes [[/r 1d10[cold]]] and [[/r 1d10[mental]]]. This damage does not wake the creature, and those who are awake can see the unconscious creature thrash as if in the throes of a nightmare while their body rimes over with layers of frost. The creature can fight against the bitter cold and monstrous shapes by attempting a @Check[type:will|dc:28|traits:cold,enchantment,mental,occult] save as a three-action activity on its turn— on a success, the creature wakes up.

Failure As success, but 1d10+6 cold and [[/r (1d10+6)[mental]]], and with a @Check[type:will|dc:32|traits:cold,enchantment,mental,occult] save to wake up.

Critical Failure The creature remains unconscious and takes [[/r (2d10+12)[cold]]] and [[/r (2d10+12)[mental]]].

source.value: Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires
